1.text: Doth not wisdom cry, And understanding put forth her voice?

2.text: On the top of high places by the way, Where the paths meet, she standeth;

3.text: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, At the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud:

4.text: Unto you, O men, I call; And my voice is to the sons of men.

5.text: O ye simple, understand prudence; And, ye fools, be of an understanding heart.

6.text: Hear, for I will speak excellent things; And the opening of my lips shall be right things.

7.text: For my mouth shall utter truth; And wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

8.text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.

9.text: They are all plain to him that understandeth, And right to them that find knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction, and not silver; And knowledge rather than choice gold.

11.text: For wisdom is better than rubies; And all the things that may be desired are not to be compared unto it.

12.text: I wisdom have made prudence my dwelling, And find out knowledge and discretion.

13.text: The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil: Pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, And the perverse mouth, do I hate.

14.text: Counsel is mine, and sound knowledge: I am understanding; I have might.

15.text: By me kings reign, And princes decree justice.

16.text: By me princes rule, And nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

17.text: I love them that love me; And those that seek me diligently shall find me.

18.text: Riches and honor are with me; Yea, durable wealth and righteousness.

19.text: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; And my revenue than choice silver.

20.text: I walk in the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of justice;

21.text: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, And that I may fill their treasuries.

22.text: Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, Before his works of old.

23.text: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, Before the earth was.

24.text: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, When there were no fountains abounding with water.

25.text: Before the mountains were settled, Before the hills was I brought forth;

26.text: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, Nor the beginning of the dust of the world.

27.text: When he established the heavens, I was there: When he set a circle upon the face of the deep,

28.text: When he made firm the skies above, When the fountains of the deep became strong,

29.text: When he gave to the sea its bound, That the waters should not transgress his commandment, When he marked out the foundations of the earth;

30.text: Then I was by him, as a master workman; And I was daily his delight, Rejoicing always before him,

31.text: Rejoicing in his habitable earth; And my delight was with the sons of men.

32.text: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me; For blessed are they that keep my ways.

33.text: Hear instruction, and be wise, And refuse it not.

34.text: Blessed is the man that heareth me, Watching daily at my gates, Waiting at the posts of my doors.

35.text: For whoso findeth me findeth life, And shall obtain favor of Jehovah.

36.text: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: All they that hate me love death.
